sections.heading: for title; effective words.Unless such intention is expressly negatived by the language in the instrument, a covenant in a conveyance of real property that the grantor is seized, or lawfully seized, or words to like effect, shall be interpreted as a covenant that the grantor has good title to the ve
sections.text: for title; effective words.Unless such intention is expressly negatived by the language in the instrument, a covenant in a conveyance of real property that the grantor is seized, or lawfully seized, or words to like effect, shall be interpreted as a covenant that the grantor has good title to the very estate in quantity and quality which he purports to convey.SourceLaws 1923, c. 111, ยง 1, p. 269;C.S.1929, ยง 76-110;R.S.1943, ยง 76-206.AnnotationsGrantor had good title to estate in quality and quantity. Gettel v. Hester, 165 Neb. 573, 86 N.W.2d 613 (1957).
